message_1: Given that sin(x) = 0.5, find the value of x using the inverse trigonometric function.
message_2:
To find the value of x using the inverse trigonometric function, we can use the arcsin (also written as sin^(-1)) function. 

sin^(-1)(sin(x)) = sin^(-1)(0.5)

x = sin^(-1)(0.5)

x = 30° or π/6 radians

Keep in mind that the sine function is periodic, so there are infinitely many solutions for x. The general solution can be expressed as:

x = 30° + 360°n or π/6 + 2πn (for even values of n)
x = 180° - 30° + 360°n or 5π/6 + 2πn (for odd values of n)

where n is an integer.
